radiographic_examinations.findings: Small bilateral pleural effusions and adjacent atelectasis; small hiatal hernia; small focus of enhancement in the liver potentially indicating a hemangioma; tiny amount of fluid in the gallbladder fossa; biliary stent and subhepatic drain in place; pneumobilia; fat stranding and fluid surrounding the pancreas; spleen, adrenal glands, and kidneys within normal limits; normal caliber of intra-abdominal loops of large and small bowel; small amount of free fluid tracking along the mesentery; normal contour of the abdominal aorta; no suspicious lytic or sclerotic lesions.
